aside.p: Split out the option to have Mechanical Turk players from that of ordinary captive players. While working on administration, finally clean up instructions. As it is now, experimenters can select from several defaults (lottery, no lottery, and Mechanical Turk) or upload custom instructions. These can still be changed in the usual way.

This also marks the first no-wait database implementation: connections will now wait perpetually in order to be serviced instead of timing out. This is part of a broader set of actions to reduce database contention for large (multi-hundred) player games.
